info.headline: Variable fonts are on the horizon.

points.topic: With a single CSS file you can change size, width, weight and even height.
This will be a game changer for typography on the web in terms of control and in terms of size.
Current Problem - loading multiple typefaces which means large download size.
How the content is displayed is of the utmost importance.
This is most apparent in situations where speeds of website parsing is different.
Open Sans was served by Google Fonts 26 billion times last week.  There are incentives to figure out a way to do this better, i.e. Performance.
A variable font is a single font file that can act like any font a designer could want.
Some of the variations - Weight, Width, Italic, Size, Grade, Slant.
Don't forget about different languages and text size because of content.
Also don't forget about screen sizes.
Using properties of font-feature-settings and font-variation-settings lets you tap into those properties.
